title: Syndra Ultimate
body: I've just been thinking about counterplay against syndra, and i was thinking that maybe you should be able to qss her ultimate. What do you guys think? Hit me up with some thoughts

replies.body: Buy an houglass on your adc. Very fun :^)

Use Zed, he can counter Syndra.
Ult when she ults, and use shadow (your W) to dodge her ultimate, in this case you will most likely win.

I'm just thinking for adc's I guess. And i completely agree with your qss explanation sorry, you are correct. It was just late and i was just brain storming. Thought there needs to be some sort of item an adc can take up against a syndra

with duskblade, 1.6k true damage cho'gath, veigar, lethality, zed, kayne, fizz, and generally stuff adc's don't like running around, zhonias still isn't the worst idea. But realistically, you have edge of night and guardian angel.

Hiya :)

The point of QSS is to remove *Crowd Control*. Syndra's ultimate does not apply a slow, or a stun, or a root, etc. therefore QSS won't (and shouldn't) work against it. On the other hand, Malzahar's ultimate applies a suppress, which means you can use QSS. But even though you remove the suppress, you are still going to be hit with the damage. *All QSS does is negate CC; it is not a spell shield, therefore will not negate damage*.

If you want a spell shield (completely negates Syndra's ult), you either want to play Morgana (or have one on your team), buy *Edge of Night* (if AD), or buy *Banshee's Veil* (if AP).

I hope this help :)

Thanks :D

Uh i think you're missing his point.
His point is when a Syndra starts to snowball there is no stopping her from pressing R for 40-100% of your hp, there is nothing you can do to stop her ultimate apart from obviously zhonyas, but this leaves out AD champs, edge of night is a bad item due to the countdown for the shield and it only lasting a few seconds. banshees is easily broken before she would even want to press R so that's also not a viable purchase. (apart from the magic resist components lowering her damage) 

With all that said & done, I believe Syndra is okay where she is, learn the champion & her weaknesses, play accordingly. Could say much the same with other snowbally lane bullies, as annoying as it is getting hit by an ability that isn't a skillshot for 40-100% of your maximum hp, it is balanced. There's a reason Syndra isn't a big pick in LCS/LCK etc. 

Let tanks mow her down & stay out of her range. Goodluck in your future games vs Syndra :P
